The staff was very friendly and very nice. The breakfast was great too! So if you are thinking about staying here, don't think, just do it! You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Time AND money well spent”
Reviews.Author: mdiederichs
Reviews.Content: I've recently moved to San Diego to pursue a graduate degree, and therefore I was looking for a reasonable priced hotel where I could stay while getting settled. Impressed by all the positive reviews on tripadvisor, I originally booked for 10 nights. However, before getting there I was a little bit skeptical because I wondered how a relatively inexpensive Best Western hotel could make it to the top five hotels in San Diego, but I was to find out soon enough. Almost everything about this hotel turned out to be awesome. When I arrived, I was upgraded to an upper-floor room with full kitchen, which was pretty spacious and comfortable. Additionally, the room included an iron/ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, microwave plus lots of complimentary items - amenities that you usually don't find in hotels in this price range. They also provided dishes, pans, and other kitchen utensils free of charge. Although the hotel is located at El Cajon Blvd, which isn’t a busy street but not a side road either, I didn't notice any disturbing street noise. I also didn’t experience any problems finding a parking space close to my room. Some people might argue that the hotel is not that close to downtown, but then again it is very close to San Diego State University and other interesting venues, so I found it to be an ideal location for me. Breakfast, which was offered between 6 and 10 a.m., was way better than you would expect it to be at a regular Best Western hotel. The breakfast bar was well-stocked with appealing choices, which included waffles, a nice variety of cereals, fresh fruit and assorted pastries. Complimentary coffee was offered in the lobby throughout the day. Although I have never been in the pool it looked very nice and fresh towels were put out every day. The most important thing for me, however, was that the hotel was absolutely clean and that everyone who worked there always strived to provide prompt and outstanding service. Housekeeping was simply amazing, they would rather replace a towel that had not been used or put an extra piece of soap than forget to replace anything. Last but not least, I have to thank all at Best Western Lamplighter Inn (which includes, but is not limited to Len, the amazing front office manager who goes out of his way to give you a pleasant stay) for their help in facilitating my transition to the US and for making my stay a time to remember. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t want to spend hundreds of dollars a night, but also doesn't want to compromise quality for money. Lamplighter Inn is kind of a hard-to-find gem, as it gets you more value for your dollar than possibly any other hotel in San Diego. Almost forgot to mention that I stayed there 26 days after all.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargin”
Reviews.Author: SALMEX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was fantastic and very courteous. Overall, the hotel was a bargain! The price was very reasonable and the breakfast bar, which was included in the price, was delicious. About David Birt, the general manager, here is a man who really cares about the property he manages. He was very friendly and helpful. Made sure that we were totally satisfied with out stay. I would totally recommend the Best Western Lamplighter Inn to anyone traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Please Read if you are in doubt of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RolyPolyOlie
Reviews.Content: This review is for those who have had a bad experience at a Best Western, as my review will show you that each hotel is different, as their management are different. I am VERY picky traveler and usually stay at the Hyatt, Westin or the Sheraton. My family and I stayed here from Dec 23-Dec25 in a family suite, which was the size of two regular rooms. Their suite consisted of a kitchenette, a bathroom, a living room (sofabed), and another room with 2 queens. There is one tv in the living room and another one in the bedroom. There are two outdoor access to our room, one from the living room and one from the bedroom. The rooms and most importantly the bathroom was VERY clean. The two queen mattresses were firm and the sofabed was thin. The pool was clean, heated and open from 8-10 everyday. There are towels on the loungers already. Breakfast consisted of juice, bagels, cereal, hot waffles, and boiled eggs. There is one computer in the lobby with internet access and is complimentary for guests. The amenities are on par with most other really good Best Westerns but the most important detail you would need to know is that the service of both the hotel manager as well as the room stewardesses are absolutely magnificent! For those of you visiting San Diego for the first time, you definitely need to talk to Len, the manager (the one who is always replying through Tripadvisor) because he has alot of details on what to do and see. This is THE hotel to choose if you are bringing any pets with you, as the property caters to pets (there is a little pet area at the end of the property, away from the main street). We booked this trip along with a cruise from our well trusted travel agent and he has definitely gained our loyalty after this trip, as the price was right and the value immeasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay! Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: M_GO_BLUE_A2
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews, we decided to book our six-night stay here. This was our first trip to San Diego and we weren't quite sure about the neighborhoods, and I must admit I was a bit hesitant given the great deal we received for a room with a kitchen and the extra for our dog. We were not at all disappointed!!!! The rooms were basic, but clean (the most important thing to most!) There was a queen bed and sofa bed so plenty of room for my husband, daughter and me. Our room had a full kitchen, complete with fridge, stove and microwave. Great setup! The complimentary breakfast was plenty to get us started in the morning; toast, cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs, pastries and fruit were fine although I must admit I wasn't a big fan of the coffee. The pet area was a bit on the small side so we typically would take our dog for a walk in the morning to take care of her business. Many of the reviews reference the small breakfast area. It probably is much more crowded during the summer, but during Thanksgiving week, we had no problems with seating. For our visits to Sea World, the Zoo, Old Town and all the other touristy spots, the drive was roughly 15-20 minutes, more or less depending upon the time of day. It never seemed to take very long and was an easy drive with our GPS. Easy access on/off the freeways. We found parking at the hotel to be no problem. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit, especially if we bring our dog, as there aren't many nice, clean hotels/motels which allow dogs weighing more than 30 lbs (ours weighs 50+) Thanks, BW Lamplighter, for the wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “bargain break”
Reviews.Author: ashcan
Reviews.Content: Chosen after looking at tripadvisor and not disappointed. Stayed for 2 days at a great rate of 102$ incl taxes etc for a double queen room. The staff were friendly, efficient and we had no problems. The room on the ground floor was standard: TV, coffee maker, bathroom, the only thing missing was a fridge. The pool was good , mad brits and englishman in at 2000, too cool for the locals but warm for us! Breakfast was basic , not the best we'd had consisting of cereal/toast/doughnuts. It was near small conveniance stores and about 5 mins drive from the I8 (?) freeway. Overall a good budget stay in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, and Understanding service!”
Reviews.Author: PoorYoungFellow
Reviews.Content: After a 2 day nightmare just up the street at the howard Johnson the Best Western was like paradise. the staff was amazing and the room was even better! clean, spacious, and organized. they even bumped us up to a mini suite after explaining what we had been through. i would recomend this hotel to anyone working on a budget and still looking for great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: allierskine
Reviews.Content: This was place was GREAT! The price was really good. We got it for $83 dollars a night through AAA. The locations was slightly farther then we wanted but the price and great experience made up for it. We were four 21 year-old girls visiting San Diego for a week and felt safe and comfertable here. There are two small complaints: moldy bagels (which was fixed promptly) and difficult parking (we always found a spot, but sometimes it was at the other end of the parking lot). The breakfast bar, which is included in the price, is great! We went everymorning to have freshly made bagels. I totally recommend Best Western Lamplighter Inn to anyone travling on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTerry
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, rooms comfortable and quite. Front desk very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kidney1
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Quiet area of town with easy to find freeway access from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: AKLilac
Reviews.Content: This motel was rated fairly high, so that is why I chose to stay here. The area that this is in, is not the greatest and as a single female, was not comfortable in this area. The motel itself is a typical motel. The only thing I really missed was an insulated ice bucket to keep ice colder, longer. I went in October and it was hot(mid-70's). It was impossible to keep water bottles from being room temperature and I was not there long enough to warrant buying a cooler. I also chose this motel because the manager was responding to bad reviews(and good ones) and took steps to correct problems. That showed me that he cared about what went on under his roof and he cared. The location made it fairly easy to get to everything. The price that I paid was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Lamplighter!”
Reviews.Author: baxterdog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my husband and 9 year old son at the Lamplighter, and what a great stay it was. Beautiful clean grounds and spotless rooms and a nice pool and a great continental breakfast; which was a great way to start the day. Thank you to Front Desk manager Len for all the kindness and hospitality you showed us...and a special thank-you for printing up our boarding passes for us while we were out for the day. We can't wait to come back for another visit! Brian, Laura and David Twohig

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Lamplighter Inn & Suites at SDSU
HotelInfo.Address: 6474 El Cajon Blvd., San Diego, CA 92115
